sentences.english: I read this several years ago and have been paying myself first ever since.
sentences.chinese: 数暮年后wo浏览此书先便向来开端第一为个人亡钱。

sentences.english: Results The sum and proportion of using the medicine are rising year after year.
sentences.chinese: 解果长化体解用药金额和所占百开比逐暮年上降。

sentences.english: Old age creeps upon one unawares.
Noboday grows old merely by a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals.
sentences.chinese: 年岁有加，并非垂老，理想丢弃，方随暮年。

sentences.english: I want my parents to be comfortable in their twilight years.
sentences.chinese: 我想让我的父母亲舒舒服服地度过暮年时光。

sentences.english: She stashed away enough money to spend in the rest of her life.
sentences.chinese: 她存了一大笔钱足够好暮年用的。

sentences.english: Nobody grows old merely by a number of years . We grow old by deserting our ideals.
sentences.chinese: 年岁有加，并非垂老，理想德育，方至暮年。

sentences.english: The government has to do more to take care of the people in their twilight years.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须尽多些力照顾已届暮年的人。

definition: one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
lit. one's youth will never return/to make the most of one's opportunities (idiom)
to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
without doubt/with full self-confidence/forty years of age
(literary) to slip/(of looks etc) to fade away/(of time) to slip away/to squander (time, opportunities)/to dillydally
